column1: Bibliography
BA, see Talbert 2000
BNP, see Cancik, Schneider, et al. 2002
DGRG, see Smith 1852-1857
PECS, see Stillwell 1976
Bagnall, R. S., (1993), Egypt in Late Antiquity, (Princeton: Princeton University Press).
Bedon, R., (1999), Les villes de trois Gaules: de César à Néron: dans leur contexte historique, territorial, et politique, (Paris: Picard).
Bedon, R., (2001), Atlas de villes, bourgs, villages de France au passé romain, (Paris: Picard).
Beloch, J., (1880), Der italische Bund unter Roms Hegemonie: staatsrechtliche und statistische Forschungen, (Leipzig: Teubner).
Beloch, J., (1886), Die Bevölkerung der griechisch-römischen Welt, (Leipzig: Duncker and Humblot).
Benario, H., W., (1981), ‘Amphitheatres of the Roman world’, The Classical Journal, 76.3: 255-258.
Bispham, E., (2007), From Asculum to Actium: The municipalization of Italy from the Social War to Augustus, (Oxford: Oxford University Press).
Bomgardner, D. L., (2000), The Story of the Roman Amphitheatre, (London and New York: Routledge).

Bowman, A.K., (2011), ‘Ptolemaic and Roman Egypt: Population and settlement’, in Bowman, A. K., and Wilson, A. I., (eds.), (2009a), Quantifying the Roman Economy, Oxford Studies in the Roman Economy, 1, (Oxford: Oxford University Press): 317-358.
Broshi, M., (1979), ‘The Population of Western Palestine in the Roman-Byzantine Period’, Bulletin of the American Schools of Oriental Research, 236: 1-10.
Brunt, P. A., (1971), Italian Manpower, 225 B.C.-A.D. 14, (London: Oxford University Press).
Burnham, B. C., and Wacher, J. S, (1990), The ‘small towns’ of Roman Britain, (London: Batsford).
Cancik, H., Schneider, H., et al., (2002), Brill’s New Pauly: An encyclopaedia of the ancient world, (Leiden: Brill).
Carreras-Monfort, C., (1995-1996), ‘New perspective for the demographic study of Roman Spain’, Revista de Historia de Arte e Arqueologia, 2: 59-82.
Cohen, G., (1995), The Hellenistic Settlements in Europe, the Islands, and Asia Minor, (Berkeley: University of California Press).
Cohen, G., (2006), The Hellenistic Settlements in Syria, the Red Sea Basin, and North Africa, (Berkeley: University of California Press).
Cohen, G., (2012), The Hellenistic settlements in the East from Armenia and Mesopotamia to Bactria and India, (Berkeley: University of California Press).
Cornell, T., and Matthews, J., (1982), Atlas of the Roman World, (London: Phaidon).
Golvin, J.-C., (1988), L'amphithéâtre romain: Essai sur la théorisation de sa forme et de ses fonctions, (Paris: Diffusion de Boccard).
Hansen, M. H., (2006), The Shotgun Method: The demography of the ancient Greek city-state culture, (Columbia and London: University of Missouri Press).

Hansen, M. H., and Nielsen, T. H., (2004), An Inventory of Archaic and Classical Poleis: An investigation conducted by The Copenhagen Polis Centre for the Danish National Research Foundation, (Oxford: Oxford University Press).

Hanson, J. W., (2011), ‘The urban system of Roman Asia Minor and wider connectivity’, in Bowman. A. K., and Wilson, A. I., (eds.), (2011), Settlement, Urbanization, and Population, Oxford Studies in the Roman Economy, 2, (Oxford: Oxford University Press): 229-275.
Humphrey, J. H., (1986), Roman Circuses: Arenas for chariot racing, (Berkeley: University of California Press).
Jones, A. H. M., (1937), The Cities of the Eastern Roman Provinces, (Oxford: Clarendon Press).
Keay, S., (1998), ‘The development of towns in early Roman Baetica’, in Keay, S., (ed), (1998), The Archaeology of Early Roman Baetica, Journal of Roman Archaeology, supplement 29: 55-86.
Lepelley, C., (1979 and 1981), Les cités de l'Afrique romaine au bas-empire, vols. I and II, (Paris: Etudes augustiniennes).
de Ligt, L., (2012), Peasants, Citizens, and Soldiers: Studies in the demographic history of Roman Italy, 225 B.C. – A.D. 100, (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press).
MacMullen, R., (2000), Romanization in the Time of Augustus, (New Haven, London: Yale University
McEvedy, C., (2011), Cities of the Classical World: An atlas and gazetteer of 120 centres of ancient civilization, (London: Allen Lane).
Millett, M., (1990), The Romanization of Britain: An essay in archaeological interpretation, (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press).
Nelis-Clément, J., and Roddaz, J.-M., (2008), Le cirque romain et son image, (Bordeaux: Ausonius).
Rivet, A. L. F., (1988), Gallia Narbonensis, (London: Batsford).
Russell, J. C., (1958), Late Ancient and Medieval Population, Transactions of the American Philosophical Society, 48.3.
Salmon, E. T., (1969), Roman Colonization under the Republic, (London: Thames and Hudson).
Sear, F., (2006), Roman Theatres: An architectural study, (Oxford: Oxford University Press).
Smith, W., (ed.), (1852-1857), A Dictionary of Greek and Roman Geography, (London: John Murray).
Stillwell, R., (ed.), (1976), The Princeton Encyclopedia of Classical Sites, (Princeton: Princeton University Press).
Talbert, R. J. A., (ed.), (2000), The Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World, (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press).
Wacher, J. S., (1995), The towns of Roman Britain, (London and New York: Routledge).
Wilkes, J. J., (2003a), ‘The towns of Roman Dalmatia’, in Wilson, P., (ed.), (2003), The Archaeology of Roman Towns: Studies in honour of John S. Wacher, (Oxford): 233-241.
Wilkes, J. J., (2003b), ‘The Roman Danube: An archaeological survey’, Journal of Roman Studies, 95: 124-225.

Wilson, A. I., (2011), ‘City sizes and urbanisation in the Roman Empire’, in Bowman, A. K., and Wilson, A. I., (eds.), (2011a), Settlement, Urbanization, and Population, Oxford Studies in the Roman Economy, 2, (Oxford: Oxford University Press): 161-195.
Woloch, G. M., (1983), Roman Cities, (Madison: University of Wisconsin Press).
